description.summary: protocol for capturing output contents or window contents

protocol.description: This protocol allows authorized application to capture output contents or window contents(useful for window streaming).

entry.name: temporary
entry.summary: temporary error, source will produce more frames

entry.name: permanent
entry.summary: fatal error, source will not produce frames

entry.name: resizing
entry.summary: temporary error, source will produce more frames

entry.name: transient
entry.summary: clients should copy frame before processing

request.name: destroy

description.summary: delete this object

request.description: Unreferences the frame. This request must be called as soon as it's no longer valid.

request.name: start

description.summary: start session

request.description: Start session and keeps sending frame with the given buffer.

arg.name: buffer
arg.summary: buffer to receive frame data, null for export dmabuf

request.name: frame_done

description.summary: Indicates current frame is done.

request.description: This is the ACK to the current "ready" event. The next "frame" event will be sent only when current "ready" event is acknowledged. The timestamp should be the same as the one sent in "ready" event. If the frame has the "transient" flag, all objects sent before become invalid after this event.

event.name: frame

description.summary: notify the client a new frame

event.description: Notify the client that a new frame is coming, client should copy or import dmabuf.

event.name: dmabuf_frame

description.summary: supply the client with information about the frame

event.description: Main event supplying the client with information about the dmabuf frame. If the capture didn't fail, this event is directly after the frame event. When mask is provided, x and y should be offset relative to mask surface origin. Otherwise offset_x and offset_y should always be zero.

description.summary: supply the client with object fd

event.name: ready

description.summary: indicates frame is available for reading

event.description: This event is sent as soon as the frame is presented, indicating it is available for reading. This event includes the time at which presentation happened at.

event.name: cancel

description.summary: Notifies current frame is no longer valid.

event.description: If the capture failed or if the frame is no longer valid after the "frame" event has been emitted, this event will be used to inform the client to scrap the frame.

request.name: destroy

description.summary: delete this object, used or not

request.description: Destroys the context. This request can be sent at any time by the client.

request.name: copy

description.summary: copy capture contents

request.description: Copy capture contents to provided buffer

event.name: flags

description.summary: frame flags

event.description: Provides flags about the frame. This event is sent once before the "ready" event.

event.name: ready

description.summary: buffer is copied

event.description: Inform that buffer is ready for reading

description.summary: frame copy failed

request.name: destroy

description.summary: delete this object, used or not

request.description: Destroys the context. This request can be sent at any time by the client.

description.summary: source failure reason

entry.name: selector_busy
entry.summary: selector is occupied by other context

entry.name: user_cancel
entry.summary: User cancel this context from compositor

request.name: select_source

description.summary: select source interactively

request.description: Selector is provided by compositor. Client can provide source hint to hint compositor to provide certain kinds of source.

arg.name: with_cursor
arg.summary: whether source content contains cursor or not

arg.name: mask
arg.summary: this mask is guaranteed to be at the top most

event.name: source_ready

description.summary: notify client that source is ready

event.description: This event supplies the client some information about the capture source, including the capture region relative to mask and source type.

arg.name: region_x
arg.summary: offset x of capture region relative to mask for capture contents

arg.name: region_y
arg.summary: offset y of capture region relative to mask for capture contents

event.name: source_shm_buffer

description.summary: notify client the supported shm buffer format

event.description: This event notify the client what kind of shm buffer is supported. It may be sent several times after "capture" or "create_session". If client receives dmabuf notification, it should use dmabuf instead.

event.name: source_dmabuf

description.summary: notify client the supported dmabuf format

event.description: This event notify the client what kind of dmabuf is supported. It may be sent several times after "capture" or "create_session". If client receives the notification, it should use dmabuf instead of shm buffer.

event.name: source_export_dmabuf

description.summary: notify client that compositor supports export dmabuf

event.description: This event notifies the client that compositor supports exporting dmabuf. It should be sent just once after "capture" or "create_session". Client should prefer export dmabuf over dmabuf or shm buffer.

event.name: source_buffer_done

description.summary: notify client that all supported buffer formats are sent

event.description: This event indicates an end of source_shm_buffer, source_dmabuf and source_export_dmabuf event sequence.

event.name: source_failed

description.summary: notify client that source selection is failed

event.description: There could a lot of reasons but the most common one is that selector is busy indicated by "selector_busy". Note that this event will still be sent after "source_ready" event. This is typically caused by destroying source like user closes the captured window. Client will receive a "source_destroyed" failure then, it should destroy the session and frame created from current source and re-select source by "select_source" request. A user_cancel failure is caused by user canceling the selection before acknowledgement. It is up to the client to determine whether destroies the session or re-select source.

request.name: capture

description.summary: capture one frame

request.description: This event can be called just once. A second call might result in a protocol error cause we just provide transient capture for security reason. Invoking capture means that source selected is acknowledged by client and will not change. Thus, source buffer information will follows this request to inform the client about what kind of buffers are supported.

request.name: create_session

description.summary: create a persistent session for capturing

request.description: This event can be called just once. A second call might result in a protocol error. This is often used by a screen recorder. Create a session receiving continuous frames. Invoking create_session means that source selected is acknowledged by the client and will not change. Thus, source buffer information will follows this request to inform the client about what kind of buffers are supported. Frozen clients unfreeze after selection is acknowledged. Although capture is allowed to be invoked after create_session, the image may not as expected.
